file_content.text: Force field up ahead.
It's hooked into the security program. Now all that work with the droids pays off.
I'm going to trigger every alarm in Belsavis, and the Scorpio system's going to go crazy. I hope.
Hold on, Chaney, darling.
Seems to me now's a very good time to renegotiate our deal.
This is no time for games.
What are you talking about?
I can be reasonable. Tell me what you want.
State your terms.
He's pointing his gun at me!
Turn on me, Kanjon, and those years in a cell will seem like paradise.
You're making a big mistake.
Shut up. He has a gun to my head.
I've heard your threats, but I got to look out for my interests. Don't mean we can't settle this nice, though.
We've had our problems. Don't mean I want to see you dead, but I need to look out for my interests.
You're going to authorize a credit transfer. Pay up, I find my way off Belsavis, and you can finish your little break-in.
Say the word, and the slicer dies.
What? Why me?
Nothing personal. You just make a good bargaining chip.
Now I don't want you dead, but you make a lot of threats and Ohta and I have to look out for our interests.
Now I don't want you dead, but Ohta and I are looking out for our interests.
I want you to authorize a credit transfer. Pay us enough, we'll leave Belsavis and you can finish your little break-in.
I'm making a transfer now. Take it and go.
I'll pay you from my accounts.
You got it.
Listen, you can't buy your way out of here--and like me or not, you need me.
This won't work. You know it.
Now put the gun down and try to remember that.
Heh. Ha! You really are something. All right--you can't blame me for trying. Chaney?
Triggering the alarms. Thank you.
I won't be blackmailed by you.
You traitorous scum.
Enjoy the Megasecurity Ward then, boss.
Paarkos does not participate in blackmail. Proceed.
Thank you. Kanjon's dead. We're okay.
Triggering the alarms. You owe us.
I'll remember what you did.
I pay my debts.
You could've gone along with it, you know.
Why didn't you turn on me?
You didn't treat me so bad. Kanjon did.
Save it until I'm out of the death trap, Chaney.
We'll finish this later.
Right.
Paarkos does not participate in blackmail.
Stupid alien! All of you!
They're all dead. And I don't feel so good.
I can still set off the alarms. But you make sure they know: Chaney Barrow was the best. Smartest slicer anywhere.
I'll tell them. Time to rest.
You did good, Chaney.
Hold on. You're hurt, but you're not dead.
I'll find a way to help you.
You're nice... huh.
Just get it done.
Pathetic.
I can hear a thousand electronic screams. What have you done...? Ah!
There's a door here. Heavy-duty metal, can't tell the composition.
Hey, boss. Paarkos spotted it. Blocks his ultraviolet sight.
Here's where the maranium power battery comes in. Take her out of the protective case and attach her to the door.
She'll pump out enough radiation to fatigue the metal, and you can blast on through.
That serum I found--it'll counter the radiation's effect?
The medicine comes in here?
It should.
What do I expect to find past the door?
And then, after I'm through?
Not sure. Probably going to hit the force fields soon, which puts you in Chaney's hands.
I always wanted to die young.
This is going to hurt.
No one on Belsavis is that young.
In any case, you've got that serum to cancel out the radiation.
Take it when you start feeling woozy, but try to keep your distance in the meantime.
Ready for the Megasecurity Ward?
Megasecurity Ward 23 is in the deep prison. Old, underground complex; say the infrastructure was here way before the Republic.
Imperials got the deep prison guarded, so you want to get inside, you find your own way through.
I've dealt with their kind before. Don't worry about the Empire's blockade.
The Imperials won't be a problem.
You mean we all find a way through.
Aren't you coming along?
No way any more than you and a friend get inside. Besides, we've got support to run.
After all, under those tidy uniforms, Imperials are a bunch of softies.
You make it sound so easy.
Is what it is.
Once you get to the Megasecurity Ward, we'll finish our tasks and meet up, walk you through on the comms.
I'm on computers. Paarkos is finalizing the map. Kanjon's turning off Republic monitors.
I have weapons and explosives prepared for you.
Equipment's all set. Handle it careful, call us when you're at the front door. Break-in of the century.
I want all of you focused. Someone slips, we all pay.
Let's do this right.
Remember how this feels. You'll never do a job like it again.
Now we're going to have fun.
Last job this big put me in Belsavis. I'll get it right this time.
I owe you for this, gorgeous. Let's celebrate when I get back.
[Flirt] You've been fun.
Yeah, I like that... find ourselves somewhere cozy....
Let's just get this done.
If this plan fails, you'll never leave Belsavis. I've got people who'll see to it.
Anything goes wrong, you die.
I'd like to meet them.
We have a good plan. Don't you mess up, either.
She means well. Whatever's in that place... we gonna know real soon.
What do you think?
...Nah. Pulse bomb won't do anything against that wall. Leaves us back where we started.
Got control of the droids. They'll set off every alarm on Belsavis, and the Scorpio program won't know where to look.
Rest of us were working out the plan for the break-in. Ready as we're gonna be, but there is one thing...
What is it, Kanjon?
Say what you need to say.
I get the feeling I'm not going to like this.
Why are you all looking at me?
If something's gone wrong, you need to fix it.
I don't want to hear excuses.
Not something we can fix.
While back, you made some promises. Said this break-in would make us rich, but we ain't seen no signs.
While back, you made some promises. Said this break-in would help us get offworld, but you never said why.
Getting a little tired of taking things on faith.
I can't tell you everything... but your brother knew what he was doing. I know what I'm doing. Don't toss away a fortune.
I guarantee there's money.
I can't tell you everything... but I haven't led you wrong so far. Your freedom's in sight; we just need to take it.
I guarantee I'll get you out.
You want to pass on this job? You think you can survive without me? Take your chances, but don't come crawling back.
You don't believe me? Then go!
You want to work, work. I don't have time to coddle anyone.
While back, you made some threats. Said we owed you for breaking us out.
You're plenty nasty, but some of us are wondering where this goes.
Huh. You want a promise? Do your jobs, you come out of Belsavis ready to take on the whole galaxy. You get cash, you get freedom.
Stick with me and be rewarded.
Yeah, alright.
Fair enough. I can't say much right now, but this should tide you over in the meantime.
Here's an advance on payment.
Hey...
Now can we get back to work? What's our next step?
Tiny taste of freedom and you get all cocky and smug.
Don't you dare question me!
You're a piece of garbage who'd be dead if not for me. Don't hold up the mission again.
Understood, boss.
It is time.
Droids are waiting for you, boss.
Take a look; this is the junk we got from the laboratory. Paarkos has been putting things together.
Place your acquisitions here. When Paarkos is finished, you will be protected against the Megasecurity Ward's traps.
The physical defenses aren't enough. We need to deal with that computer--the Scorpio Sanctions.
That thing has caused enough trouble.
Agreed.
Is there something you aren't telling me?
You know what that thing is?
I like to learn about the things that attack me.
You got a plan, Chaney, or just a lot of talk?
This had better be good.
I think the sanctions are a program running in the Megasecurity Ward that accesses the rest of the prison.
It controls the force fields, scanners, all that. Your equipment will only do half the job if the program's still running.
My brother didn't have a slicer when he got himself killed. She might be right.
I'm really good, but I can't disable the program. We need to distract it.
Software isn't easily distracted.
How do we do that?
Kanjon? Think you can play the gentleman and get the program to let us inside?
Maybe it just needs seducing.
Not the way I swing.
A thermal detonator in the computer core should do the trick.
I'd rather blow it to pieces.
You're not listening. I think the core is in the ward.
I can take control of the upper level security droids. Override their programming. Then, when we get to the Megasecurity Ward--bang!
I make the droids set off every alarm in the prison. The Scorpio program gets confused. Gives us a few minutes, at least.
Clever little bird.
You and the guys could upload my overrides into the droids while Paarkos and I work. Then we can go in.
Get your gear together. We're going droid-hunting.
Let's get moving.
How do I upload your controls into the droids?
Is there a trick to it?
I don't want you exposed. I'll handle the droids myself.
I'll go--the others stay here.
You doubt us.
Guess I'll just work on the plan.
Get close to each droid and use these computer spikes. They'll stop shooting after. Not before.
When we've got enough set up, I'll give you a call.
How many warden droids are still out there?
I told you already...
Tell me again.
Give me the knife! I want to try.
What's going on?
Caught ourselves a guard; thought we'd have a little fun.
You questioned him?
Does he know anything useful?
He don't know much--guards aren't in good shape between the prisoners and the Imperials coming through.
He helped us with our maps. And I'm security clearance green, now.
Think he's probably tapped out. Want me to clean up?
You captured a guard? That wasn't part of the plan!
I never permitted this!
Come on--no one's gonna miss him in all this. Besides, we learned all sorts of things.
We can kill him now, if you want. No one saw us grab him.
You should've waited for me. I've got a grudge or two against the guards myself.
Maybe I'll join in. [Hurt him]
I don't even know you. Please... ah!
Nice. Nice!
You got a bit of a temper. Think he's given all we're getting, though--want me to clean up?
Make it quick. We should get back to work.
Go ahead and kill him.
Please....
You work on Belsavis, you should know what's coming.
We saw hostages killed once, as a diplomat. It disturbed us then, too.
I don't know if I could've made that call.
At least he had some dignity.
Get out of here. Anyone tries to stop him, you answer to me.
Let him go free.
You've got to be kidding.
Don't push it.
The order was clear.
I don't think she was.
I don't think he was.
Don't make us convince you.
Maybe we'd better not push it.
Bind him and lock him up somewhere. Make sure he can't hear us.
He might be useful later.
Momma always said to save the crumbs. All right, let's go...
Don't worry about us, boss.
You are immune to mind control technologies, yet those defenses should be unavailable to the wider galaxy. Interesting.
We will continue this discussion later.
Ugh. So... what? I don't have anything to say sorry for.
A formal apology should include a gift, we know, but for now... we're sorry about that.
Sir, I'm terribly sorry. I couldn't help myself....
That was an unfortunate experience. I must commend you for your quick thinking.
Think we're all in one piece. That's a nasty security system.
We're not even in the Megasecurity Ward yet.
Look, we survived. And there's still lots to do, so let's move it.
Let's get back to work.
You got it, boss.
What were we just attacked by? One of you must know.
Anyone know about that voice?
Not a clue, boss. My brother didn't live to tell.
Anyone thinking of turning back needs to decide: What do you want to face? Me, right now? Or some half-baked security system?
Be afraid of me, not Belsavis.
No one talking about turning back, boss.
I'll--I can slice the computers. See if I can get an equipment inventory...
See? It's all good.
Yes. Yes... no.
It's almost all here--the stupid equipment is listed--but there's some pieces that aren't stored in the lab. I can pinpoint the locations.
Run down what we're missing.
Give me details.
You're doing good. Let's hear what you found out.
Nicely done, Chaney.
We're moving out. We've got a fight ahead of us.
Weapons ready, everyone.
All due respect, we ain't fit. My hand shaking from that gas, don't think I could slaughter a bantha cub.
What're we missing, Chaney?
Carbonite trap. It's in the armory.
Need that to freeze yourself, hide your life signs from the Megasecurity Ward scanners. Only way to get in.
Spent maranium power battery. Hazardous waste containment.
Radiation'll weaken the door seals. Old Black Sun trick.
Anti-radiation serum. Water filters.
Help you survive that power battery. Still, if that's all that's missing, we can count ourselves lucky.
Me and the others can pack up, start creeping to the next security zone... assuming you can recover those three pieces.
Carbonite bomb from the armory, battery from hazard containment, serum from the water filters. You finish up here and I'll find them.
Agreed.
You got it.
I'll be fine, but I don't want you dead at the hands of the Republic.
Will all of you be okay?
Paarkos will show them hidden paths.
I will handle the Republic.
That'll take care of that. Watch yourself.
You stick to the plan. No improvising, no surprises. Got it?
Stay out of trouble.
Oh, I got it.
The laboratory map. We gather what we need.
We'll start scrounging for basic equipment. For the bigger stuff, though, guess it's the laboratories.
Years back, my brother tried what you're saying--found traps, sensors, blast doors, force fields... got himself killed.
Only way in is to short out what security you can and try to survive the rest. Takes prep we ain't done and a bundle of equipment.
Then start putting together a list of resources we'll need.
Let's get on it.
The rest of you, I want maps, security assessments, anything you can get me. We'll do this job right.
Yes, boss.
No one said it would be easy. But if you're not in all the way....
Are you with me or not?
Huh. In.
Paarkos will join you.
For now.
Don't have any other plans, so... I'll start a list of what we need....
You need to give me something useful. I'm on a tight schedule.
Don't waste my time.
That's going to make life difficult.
But you can handle it... right?
We need a way.
You can do this, though?
I'm sure you'll find a way.
Yeah. Yeah, I can manage.
It's doable, though?
Sure, darling. Why not?
Now, let me get you a list of what we need...
...bet we can pick some tools off the bodies, but not the specialized stuff. Take a look.
Repulsor coils, rebreathers, computer spikes... carbonite traps? Where're we going to get this?
Computer spikes and rebreathers are simple... but engineering equipment? Where do we find that here?
Carbonite traps, repulsor coils... I couldn't requisition half of this from the Chiss, sir.
Radiation equipment, carbonite traps... interesting choices, but these items will be... difficult to procure.
Don't look at me--my brother took five years to assemble this stuff. It's up to our miracle worker.
Repulsor coils, rebreathers, computer spikes, carbonite traps... all the best, but I don't have a clue where you'll find it.
We can't exactly order this stuff from offworld, so we'll have to improvise. Tear apart the housing, guard towers, anything you can.
We'll need to salvage it.
Been a long time. Moving out, then.
Let the killing begin.
Think. We've lived on Belsavis for years. How do we get special equipment?
One of you must have an idea.
Paarkos has an answer.
He wants to send you to the laboratories. Huh.
Get yourselves ready. We're going to blast every hideout and Republic ship until we have what we need.
Time to raid the Republic.
Well, I could use some sport.
This I like.
Chaney. The laboratories.
What? Hey! The laboratories. The medical facilities.
The labs'll be sealed off. Guards'll set up a kill zone to keep us from looting the place.
The laboratories have all sorts of equipment, and they can track more down. One person slips in and opens the back entrance... we can all follow.
I'm not worried about Republic kill zones. If we need that equipment, I'll get us inside--just be ready to follow.
Leave it to me.
Sure, boss.
I never heard of any laboratory on Belsavis.
Explain this laboratory.
It's in the next security zone. They say it's a medlab, but everyone knows they experiment on prisoners.
It's a stupid idea--but then, I ain't heard any better.
You survive... maybe we have more to talk about.
I could get inside a Republic lab. What's your plan while I'm gone?
If I go, what'll you be doing?
Well... so far we've barely had time to pick up a blaster, so once we've armed ourselves, we can be more useful.
I'm working on the computers now. Soon as you open a way, I'll know. We all follow. Sir.
Now, Ohta, why are you talking like that with a lady around?
It is my nature to shed blood. I will not hide it or wait any longer.
Huh. Don't think you have to.
Remember to make an example out of the troublemaker.
They expect a leader, but that's what they hate. Surprise them.
Everyone's watching us, sir...
Your first test of leadership.
We are grateful you freed us. Now flee before I strangle you.
I don't have time for games. If you think you can kill me, take your shot. Otherwise, sit down.
If you have a problem, tough.
You've got fangs. You and me can go far together.
I like your attitude.
Heh.
That's a generous offer. Tell you what--I'll think it over.
Troublemaker, eh? [Shoot him]
Stupid. Stupid...
Some of you know about Megasecurity Ward 23. Deepest pit in this prison. Together, we have the skills to get inside.
Break in, take what they're hiding--heist of the century. Follow my lead and we'll all walk away rich.
With what's in there, we can all make it off this rock. You just need to follow my lead.
Don't bother arguing. It's not like you have a choice.
Megasecurity Ward 23. Paarkos has heard the rumors.
Dead. Just like that...
Heh. Don't worry about Chaney. Kanjon Slyke. That's Paarkos, and you just killed Ohta.
Always wanted to be rich...
Want to get out. Need to get out...
Don't like not knowing, don't want to die...
Heh. Kanjon Slyke--she's Chaney, that's Paarkos and Ohta.
You got confidence, pretty bird, but Megasecurity ain't just breaking windows and slitting throats. We're talking bad things there.
Bad things? See, I can enjoy those....
[Flirt] I like danger.
Nice, darling. This might work out after all.
You spoke of the Megasecurity Ward.
What about the ward?
You sound pretty sure, but Megasecurity ain't just breaking windows and slitting throats. We're talking bad things there.
I take it you have some experience.
What do you know about it?
I didn't pick this crew at random. You know this can work.
That's why I came to you.
You're awfully soft for a professional killer.
You sound like a coward.
I'm a common sense man, with a clue what I'm getting into.
Don't think we're on the same page.
Somewhere in here, you're going to trigger a gas attack. There's a rebreather with your equipment; you want to use it.
Hope this message finds you, pretty bird. That reward of yours panned out.
Hey, boss. Hope this message finds you. That reward of yours panned out.
Imps pay pretty well, and they got me off Belsavis. I'm a free man now.
Thought I'd show you some appreciation, offer a little tip--job I have to pass on.
Follow these coordinates, and there's a prize waiting. Think of me when you're fighting for it.
Follow these coordinates, and there's a prize waiting. You just have to fight for it.
Paarkos does not participate in blackmail.
